response.answer:
According to the Karbon user guide, to enable 2FA authentication:

1. Click your Bybit Profile icon > Account and Security page
2. Scroll down to Advanced Protection
3. Click Google Two Factor Authentication settings
4. Enter verification code from email
5. Download Google Authenticator app & scan QR code
6. Enter authentication code & click Confirm

That's it!
response.context:
Account on your desktop or Continue on your mobile. 
 
4.2.How To enable 2FA authentication 
Step 1- Click your Bybit Profile icon and go to account and security page 
Step 2- In account and security scroll down the page to advance protection. 
Step 3- Click settings related to google two factor authentication. 
Step 4- Check your email to verification code and enter that code to security verification.
Step 5- downloads google authentication app and scan the QR code given in the popup window and enter the 
authentication code in given field in the popup window. 
Step 6- Click confirm to finish the setup
on the top right corner of your trading page, go to “Subaccounts” then click “Management “in created sub account. 
Step 2- Click on 'Create New Key' located on the right side of the 'API Management' page 
Step 3- Click system-generated API keys. 
Step 4- The following pop-out window will appear. Please configure your API key according to your trading needs. 
Step 5- Enter 2FA code and confirm. You have successfully created your API key!

response.answer:
To enable 2FA authentication, follow these steps:

1. Click the Bybit Profile icon and go to account and security page.
2. Scroll down to Advance protection and click settings related to Google two-factor authentication.
3. Check your email for a verification code and enter it in the security verification field.
4. Download the Google Authentication app, scan the QR code, and enter the authentication code.
5. Click Confirm to finish setup.

You can also enable 2FA by creating an API key: 
1. Go to Subaccounts > Management.
2. Click Create New Key on the right side of the API Management page.
3. Configure your API key and click System-generated API keys.
4. Enter 2FA code and confirm.

Let me know if you need further assistance!

response.answer:
To enable 2FA, follow these steps:

1. Click the Bybit Profile icon.
2. Go to Account and Security page.
3. Scroll down to Advanced Protection.
4. Click settings related to Google Two Factor Authentication.
5. Enter verification code from email.
6. Download Google authentication app, scan QR code, and enter code.

Or, if you want to create an API key with 2FA:

1. Go to Subaccounts > Management in the top right corner of your trading page.
2. Click Create New Key on the right side of the API Management page.
3. Configure API key according to your needs.
4. Enter 2FA code and confirm.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you need further assistance.

response.answer: We're currently in the context of Karbon UI. I'll provide concise answers related to the guide. What would you like assistance with?
response.context:
3.0.Home 
Brief introduction to Karbon UI 
 
3.1. Welcome Message & Links 
 
3.2.Color Theme Changing 
Users have the option to change the site's color theme by using a toggle button. This button is conveniently located 
in the top right corner of the site, making it easily accessible. The toggle allows users to switch between yellow and 
green themes. 
 
3.3.Live/Paper Accounts 
Using the 'Live Accounts' and 'Paper Accounts' links in the navigation bar, users can easily navigate to the
4.3.How to Create Sub Account on bybit 
 
Step 1- Go to user setting by clicking profile icon in bybit. 
Step 2- Click subaccounts tab 
Step 3- Click Create subaccount button. 
Step 4- Click standard subaccount. 
Step 5- Enter any name without space and select account type to standard 
Step 6- Click confirm to finish the setup. 
 
4.4.Create Your API Key on Bybit Subaccount 
Step 1- enter your account's settings page. Perform a login if prompted. Alternatively, you can click the human icon
Admin User Responsible for implementing and maintaining security 
services, such as adding users, building profiles, or 
managing general site administration 
Admin User This is another existing user type. able to add strategies 
to the system 
Elite User Auto execution subscribe and account balance 
1000USDT 
Pro User Not defined yet 
Pro + User Not defined yet 
 
2.2.Sign Up 
To use this platform user needs to create an account by simply providing their Name, Email, and password

response.answer:
To enable 2FA authentication, follow these steps:

1. Click your Bybit Profile icon and go to account and security page.
2. Scroll down to Advance Protection.
3. Click settings related to Google two-factor authentication.
4. Check email for verification code and enter it in the security verification field.
5. Download Google Authentication app, scan QR code, and enter authentication code.
6. Click Confirm to finish setup.
response.context:
Account on your desktop or Continue on your mobile. 
 
4.2.How To enable 2FA authentication 
Step 1- Click your Bybit Profile icon and go to account and security page 
Step 2- In account and security scroll down the page to advance protection. 
Step 3- Click settings related to google two factor authentication. 
Step 4- Check your email to verification code and enter that code to security verification.
Step 5- downloads google authentication app and scan the QR code given in the popup window and enter the 
authentication code in given field in the popup window. 
Step 6- Click confirm to finish the setup
on the top right corner of your trading page, go to “Subaccounts” then click “Management “in created sub account. 
Step 2- Click on 'Create New Key' located on the right side of the 'API Management' page 
Step 3- Click system-generated API keys. 
Step 4- The following pop-out window will appear. Please configure your API key according to your trading needs. 
Step 5- Enter 2FA code and confirm. You have successfully created your API key!

data.message: what steps for register two factor auth

response.answer:
To enable 2FA authentication on Karbon, follow these steps:

1. Click Profile icon > Account and Security
2. Scroll down to Advanced Protection
3. Click Google Two-Factor Authentication settings
4-6. Follow the prompts to complete setup
